Data Clean Up Module¶

lsi_datacleanup.clean_up(matrix_row)[source]¶

This method is called by clean_up_data(). Runs through an input string essay and cleans it up. Calls multiple functions to remove stop words, convert plurals, remove symbols, separate the words, etc.

E.g.
‘The concepts were generally easy to follow.’ ->[‘concept’, ‘generally’, ‘easy’, ‘follow’]
Args:
matrix_row (str): string to be cleaned up
Returns:
list of relevant and interesting words from the string
lsi_datacleanup.clean_up_data(matrix)[source]¶

Main method called to clean up data/matrix input. Each row represents one student essay, and each row is cleaned using the clean_up() method.

E.g. [‘It was moderately difficult.’ ‘The concepts were generally easy to follow.’] -> [[‘moderately’, ‘difficult’][‘concept’, ‘generally’, ‘easy’, ‘follow’]]

Args:
matrix (2D list): name of matrix to be cleaned up
Returns:
clean matrix
lsi_datacleanup.clean_up_data_no_prune(matrix)[source]¶

Same as clean_up_data(), but this method doesn’t cut off stop words.

Args:
matrix (2D list): name of matrix to be cleaned up
Returns:
clean matrix
lsi_datacleanup.clean_up_no_prune(matrix_row)[source]¶

Same as clean_up() but this doesn’t call remove_words().

Args:
matrix_row (str): string to be cleaned up
Returns:
list of relevant and interesting words from the string
lsi_datacleanup.conv_uni(unicode_row)[source]¶

This method converts unicode data into ascii. We don’t want unicode symbols. Unicode to ascii table found here http://www.utf8-chartable.de/

Args:
unicode_row (str): string to be cleaned up
Returns:
string now in ascii
lsi_datacleanup.merge_rows(matrix_row)[source]¶

This method combines a list of words into one string.

E.g. [ ‘hello’, ‘hi’ ] -> [ ‘hello hi’ ]

Args:
matrix_row (str): list of words to be combined
Returns:
combined words in one string
lsi_datacleanup.plurals(words)[source]¶

This method is converts plural words into singular. It works by calling a third party library by nltk.

E.g. ‘grapes’ -> ‘grape’ ‘mountain’ -> ‘mountain’ # already singular

Args:
words (str): list of words to be converted
Returns:
list of words in singular form
lsi_datacleanup.remove_dot(words)[source]¶

Removes dots after a word.

E.g. ‘This.’ -> ‘This’

Args:
words (str): list of words to be filtered
Returns:
list of words after removing ‘.’ suffix
lsi_datacleanup.remove_punc(sentence)[source]¶

Removes all the punctuations from a sentence.

Note:
pad punctuations with space just in case so 2 words wont stick together e.g. avoid this: “by this!Also” –> “by thisAlso”
Args:
sentence (str): sentence string.
Returns:
string sentence without punctuation
lsi_datacleanup.remove_words(words)[source]¶

This method filters out specific words from an input of words.

TODO: not hardcode the stop words in this method

Args:
words (str): list of words to be cleaned
Returns:
list of words that were not filtered
lsi_datacleanup.strip_html(text)[source]¶

This function is by Fredrik Lundh Convert html special characters into normal ascii characters.

Args:
text (str): sentence string.
Returns:
string sentence without punctuation
